summary: A small tutorial that shows how to set up custom hair so shaders affect them.
descriptionHtml:
[left][size=2]It's as cold as Oblivion out here. My sword, my armor, even my skin is frosted over.
But my hair is FABULOUS and UNTOUCHED by said Frost! :(

[/size][size=5] [color=#BF9000] Shader Friendly Custom Hair[/color][/size]

[size=4][/size][color=#BF9000][size=4]What is this?[/size][/color]
[size=3]This is a tutorial for setting custom hair (Apachii SkyHair, SG Hairs, etc etc.) to be affected by shaders.
"Shaders?" you may ask, "I haven't seen any shaders." Actually, you have. Spells, snow accumulation from [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27563/?]Wet and Cold
[/url]Â or [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19660/?]Get Snowy[/url], the flesh deterioration from [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36158/?]Necromancy-- Undead FX[/url]. These are all shaders.
[/size]
[color=#BF9000][size=4]Why?[/size][/color]
[size=3]I was tired of having every part of my character be affected by Wet and Colds' snow shader except my hair.
So I scoured the Nexus looking for a solution. I didn't see any solutions until I check the optional files for Vilja.
And then, there it was: "Dogiers Shader Friendly Hair for Vilja".

So that's where this came from. I picked apart the changes Dogier made, and found which one enabled the shaders.[/size]

[size=4] [color=#BF9000]Usage[/color]
[/size][size=3]The tutorial itself should be easy enough to follow along, but my artistic skills are non-existent. This was an hours time, and it shows.
So if you make a better one, send it to me and I'll host it (while giving you credit for it, obviously).[/size]

[size=4]ALSO: [size=3]I forgot to mention it in the tutorial (because I rushed to make it because of another mod I'm making to include custom races in race checks), but hairline meshes already have the 4846 flag. So you don't have to touch those.[/size][/size][size=2]
[/size]
[size=3][color=#ff0000]BACK UP THE HAIR MESHES BEFORE ATTEMPTING THIS!![/color]
Or keep a copy of the original mod, either way. [color=#ff0000]YOU WERE WARNED.[/color]

[color=#BF9000]Permissions:[/color]
Permission? It's a tutorial. I'd like a mention and one for Dogier if you share this, but, it's a tutorial. There really isn't any work to steal.

[color=#BF9000]Credits:[/color]
Dogier, for actually figuring this problem out
The Paint.Net Team, for creating such an easy and versatile program.
Bethesda, [s]for creating the most realistic crash simulator this side of Deadly Premonition[/s], I mean a wonderful(ish) game to mod.[/size][/left]
